text: uh hi everyone Anthony pound Tano here
the internet's busiest music nerdy and
it's time for a review of this new smino
project love for rent this is a brand
new LP from St Louis rapper singer and
songwriter smino who is now on his third
full-length LP as he continues to build
up a pretty respectable discography
which blends elements of hip-hop r b
contemporary soul and pop now it's been
my opinion on previous smino albums that
many of these elements assembled in a
somewhat Bland way I'm sure the
passionate fan base he's built up to
this point will strongly disagree but I
will say this I think love for rent is
handily smino's best and sharpest
project yet of course it is built on
pretty much the same array of influences
that we've heard him dealing in in the
past on many tracks here we have The
Eccentric vocal layering of like a
Kendrick Lamar song but with a more
unique Twist on it this time around and
while it does sound quite updated the
melodic triplet flows of Bone
Thugs-N-Harmony are definitely mixed
into to Cimino's DNA somewhere too and
it also sounds like he was listening to
quite a bit of outcast in the lead up to
this LP as well so the influences are
there the influences are clear but more
importantly the song structures the bars
the hooks and the melancholic Melodies
just hit which is just a mark of good
songwriting as well as an increased
knack for tasteful ear worms that smino
seems to have on this record whether
you're talking about the very long and
gratifying song curtains toward the end
of the record or the extremely catchy
mode in a minute in the middle of the
record or the First full song on the lp
no else which has some really awesome
deep bass lines some sparkling chord
progressions and these melodic
harmonized rap flows that take me back
to Kendrick projects like good kid Mad
City but with the r b Vibes embraced on
that album pushed even further here next
we have the song 90 Proof which I
enjoyed as a single and love even more
in the context of the record not only
for J Cole's passionate and melodious
contribution to the track but [ __ ]
smino's ascending vocal lines that hit
with that harmonious flare right at the
end of every bar are fantastic the
chunky mesmerizing beat that rides
Underneath It All is a great foundation
and plus I love the squeaky weird
falsetto inflections that he plays with
on his verses the track is just loaded
with personality and color the song Pro
freak manages to rock a lot of that same
moodiness and addictive Melodies but
bring more of a party vibe to the table
with a more driving beat some sound
effects as well as wild group vocals it
pops but there's a smoothness to it
that's really nice especially with
dochi's slick verse on the cut meanwhile
things on Olas Kendrick get much woozier
and looser but do so with some crazy
textured production that makes up for
how sparse it is with how creative it is
not to mention all of this space leaves
a lot of room for smino to come through
with some of the most eccentric vocal
ideas he has to offer definitely some
Controlled Chaos happening on this track
with all these cracked erratic vocal
inflections that break up the melodic
lines there are moments on the lp where
I think things do get a bit too bare and
Atmospheric though leuphoria is an
example Garden lady later on the lp as
well but the song Blue Billy leaves a
much larger impact pretty funny contrast
going on between the music and lyrics
frankly the chord progression on the
track and loungey pianos come across as
very romantic and sweet but that just
ends up setting the stage for smino to
paint a picture of all of these setup
chicks and hitters and dealers that he
knows it's like a soft gentle Hustler's
Anthem vocal acrobatics over a very
sweet and simple instrumental is pretty
much the appeal of the song matinee as
well and later defibrillator warms
things up with some of the most
beautiful elegant and Heavenly vocal
harmonies on the entire project while
the track settled down takes a more
playful approach with a persistent beat
and a lot more gospel influences flowing
through the vocal work on this one some
of which borders a little bit too much
on being kind of cartoony but I do
appreciate samino throwing in a track
with a little extra bite at this point
on the project which is also the case
for pudgy featuring Lil Uzi vert though
I think this track is a much smoother
and much more appropriate of a banger
plus Uzi actually seems like he really
took care to notice the vibe and the
energy of the track before putting in
his own contribution I think it's one of
his most complimentary features ever
there's also a really bright and
gratifying finisher on the lp with some
of the prettiest vocal layers on the
entire project the soul influences come
through it a big way on this one and
those are pretty much the major points
on the lp I think the appeal of this
album is yes very simple it's not too
complicated but there is a beautiful
Purity to usmino has accomplished on
this album aside from a few tracks of
being a little underwhelming I think the
record's biggest sin is that it is a tad
2 derivative here and there which yes in
my opinion was also a problem on smino's
previous projects but it's much less so
the case here I think smino embodies his
influences a lot more effectively on
this project but also the songwriting
and the melodic ideas that are displayed
across the record the choruses are just
too good to deny but yeah that's it
that's everything I wanted to say about
this really sweet enjoyable album with a
lot of Great Cuts on it I am a feeling a
decent eight on this smino record
transition have you given this thing a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should I review
next hit the like if you like Please
Subscribe and please don't cry hit the
Bell as well over here next to my head
is another video that you can check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel Anthony fantano smino
forever
